quest.name: Rook Before You Reap
journal: Stephanivien seems excited to share something with you.

Stephanivien is excited to share with you the completion of his latest invention, but his enthusiasm is soon dampened by the arrival of his father. It would seem that Svara, a dragon of great size and ferocity, is en route to Skyfire Locks─a collection of redoubts that House Haillenarte is honor-bound to defend. In response to Lord Baurendouin's dire need for reinforcements, Stephanivien pledges the participation of the manufactory's machinists. Speak with the chief machinist and discuss what is to be done.

With the majority of his machinists untested in battle, Stephanivien decides to entrust the use of his prototype to you. He asks that you employ the autoturret in the defense of Skyfire Locks, and demonstrate to Lord Baurendouin the full extent of machinistry's effectiveness.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, splendid. You arrived at the very moment I completed my newest machinist marvel─well, within the very hour, at least.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis unfortunate that many Ishgardians cannot appreciate the practicality of my work. People such as my father, for instance...

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: <sniff> Ugh, is there naught that can be done for this dreadful odor...? Stephanivien, my son, the days of shunning your knightly training have come to an end.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: Never should I have allowed you to set foot inside this workshop! Had I but known that the curiosity you displayed as a boy would develop into this all-consuming distraction...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Is that all you came to say, Father? I am well aware of your distaste for─

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: Nay, Stephanivien, there is more. House Dzemael has sounded a call to arms, and House Haillenarte is bound to answer.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: As you well know, however, our companies are light on lances. If we are to avoid dishonoring our name, every able soldier─mine own son included─must take up spear and sword and march to battle.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: I have not the disposition for charging into enemy ranks, Father.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: I did not raise a coward! Consider your next words carefully, boy─as manufactory chief, I hold the authority to expel anyone from this workshop.

dialogue.name: KIKOUSHI01699
dialogue.text: (-Machinist-)On parchment, mayhap... There's only one chief we answer to.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Aye, I understand that our ranks have grown thin. Thus is our house in dire need of the support my machinists will bring.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Challenging the might of dragons with spear and sword is the work of seasoned heroes─warriors possessed of unflagging stamina and robust physique.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Equipped with a firearm, however, even the scrawniest commoner could engage those same scaled demons from afar. Think of it, Father! If the masses were trained in the machinist profession, the casualties of fang and claw would be considerably diminished.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Machinist companies would soon form the backbone of our defense, and, as the master of the manufactory, the accolades would belong to House Haillenarte.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: Train the masses!? Foolish boy! No lowborn army could ever replace a contingent of disciplined knights!

dialogue.name: FROMELAUT
dialogue.text: It is time, my lord. Svara is expected to descend upon our defenses within the hour.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Svara!? You mean to engage that great brute with naught but our knights!?

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: What would you have me do? The dragon flies straight as an arrow for our very own Skyfire Locks. Should we let them be destroyed, the price will be steep in both coin and honor.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Father, you must allow me to deploy my machinists! Once you have witnessed them in battle, even you will be unable to deny their effectiveness.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: ...Do as you will, Stephanivien. As matters stand, I would not turn away a lame chocobo if it offered to defend our holdings. Be certain to assemble your forces at the Locks ere Svara arrives.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Oh dear. I fear I have allowed my passions to impair my better judgment─of all my budding machinists, only you have seen true combat.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis to you, then, that I would entrust the use of my prototype device. The “rook,” as I have taken to calling it, is an autoturret─a type of machinist weapon that fights on its own!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Do you recall Rostnsthal's explanation of the aetherotransformer? That contraption at your waist will convert your body's aether into the lightning-aspected energy required to power the turret. You need simply to activate the weapon, and it will supplement your own attacks.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Svara has plagued House Haillenarte for long years. Should you employ the rook to good effect, then we may rid ourselves of both a deadly enemy and my father's antiquated notions in one fell swoop.

obj.n: Always the Last Place You Look
